sen.j: 金森宗和の祖父金森長近は織田信長・豊臣秀吉・徳川家康に仕えた武将で、千利休に茶を学んだ。

sen.j: 父で長近の養子の金森可重もまた千道安に学び茶の湯に秀でていた。
sen.e: Sowa's father, Arishige KANAMORI, who was adopted, learned tea ceremony from Doan SEN, and was also an excellent master of tea ceremony.

sen.j: 初代金森宗和ははじめは可重の嫡子として高山藩にあったが、廃嫡となり宇治・京都に移って茶の湯に専念する。
sen.e: Sowa KANAMORI (the first head of his own lineage) was at the beginning in the care of Takayama Domain as a legitimate son of Arishige, but later disinherited the family lineage and moved to Uji in Kyoto in order to study the art of tea ceremony.

sen.j: 最初は父譲りの道安の流れを汲んでいたと思われるが、古田重然や小堀遠州の影響を受けながら後水尾天皇をはじめ公家との交流のなかで「姫宗和」と呼ばれる優美な茶風を築きあげた。
sen.e: Although it is thought that he was at first influenced by the tea ceremony of Doan as his father was, he gradually perfected his own elegant style, called "Hime Sowa," which was created as a result of his friendships with the aristocrats such as Emperor Gomizunoo, as well as having had the influence of tea ceremony masters such as Shigenari FURUTA and Enshu KOBORI.

sen.j: 加賀藩3代藩主前田利常より召し抱えの意があったが、宗和はこれを辞して2代七之助方氏が出仕した。
sen.e: When there was an offer for Sowa to serve Toshitsune MAEDA, the third lord of Kaga Domain, as a tea ceremony master of the house, Sowa declined it and instead had 七之助方氏, the second head of the family, serve the lord.
sen.cmt: 七之助方氏は読み方が不明です。

sen.cmt: （金森）方助の読みを補足、七之助は読みが確認できず漢字を補足しました。

sen.j: これより代々、金森家は金沢にあって加賀藩に仕え1700石を領した。
sen.e: From this time, Kanamori family served Kaga Domain in Kanazawa, and controlled over the land worth 1,700 koku (approximately 306,000 liters of crop yields).

sen.j: 7代知直の時に金森家は一時断絶となり、推挙により多賀直昌が宗家を継承することになった。
sen.e: Kanamori family came to its end of the line at the time of the seventh head of the family Tomonao, and the lineage of the head family was inherited by Naomasa TAGA, who became a new head on recommendation.

sen.j: 8代多賀直昌は5000石を賜っていたが、宗家継承に際し隠居して茶道に専念した。
sen.e: Despite the fact that Naomasa TAGA, the eighth head of the family, received the territory worth 5,000 koku (approximately 900,000 liters of crop yields), he retired in order to concentrate on tea ceremony when he became the head.

sen.j: また宗和の門人である和泉国陶器藩主小出三尹に宗和の妹が嫁いだことから、陶器藩および高山藩でも宗和流が行われた。
sen.e: As the sister of Sowa married to Mitsumasa KOIDE, the lord of Toki Domain in Izumi Province and a Sowa's disciple, Sowa school was practiced in Toki Domain as well as in Takayama Domain.

sen.j: 高山藩が天領に転じて後は寺院を中心に伝承されて現在に至っている。
sen.e: After Takayama Domain became tenryo (a shogunal demesne), the tea ceremony of Sowa school has been mainly practiced in temples to this day.
